body.p: Amino acids can be classified by:

multiple_choice.choice: the characteristics of their side chains.
the number of carbon and nitrogen bonds they contain.
the number of carbon-carbon double bonds in their fatty acids.
the number of disulfide bonds they form.
the ionization properties of their polar charged groups.

feedback.p: Correct. Side chains can be classified as polar (charged or uncharged), nonpolar, etc.
Incorrect. Amino acids do not contain fatty acids.
Incorrect. Disulfide bonds occur between certain amino acids, not within them.
Incorrect. Even though the state of ionization can vary with conditions, amino acids are not classified based on their ionization properties.

hint.p: Consider the properties they contribute to the proteins they make.
